Description: Fragment of round handle at neck join of an Apulian pottery transport amphora. Clay near fine pink-buff; cream slip. Rectangular stamp.
Curator's comments: Name Rumas. D. Manacorda, Le fornaci romane di Giancola (Brindisi), Bari, 2012, 456 is from a different die.
Bibliographic references: Stoddart 1847 / Memoir on the inscribed pottery of Rhodes, Cnidus and other Greek Cities (337)
